name: Theft in the first degree
text:
(1)  A person commits the offense of theft in the first degree if the person commits theft:



	(a)	Of property or services, the value of which exceeds $20,000;
	(b)	Of a firearm; or
	(c)	Of dynamite or other explosive.



	(2)  Theft in the first degree is a class B felony. [L 1986, c 314, §63; am L 1992, c 289, §1; am L 1993, c 14, §1]
